question:
You recently bought a piece of equipment for your kitchen but it did not work. You pho0ned the shop but no action was taken. Write a letter to the shop manager. In your letter

● describe the problem with the equipment

● explain what happened when you phoned the 

● say what you would like the manager to do.
text: I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with the recently purchased Food Processor from your store.

The Processor is the latest model of the Magic Bullet which has an inbuilt feature of no noise while working. However, on the first instance of the use, I noticed some odd noise coming out of it and also the machine stopped working as the motor got heated.

To get it checked I called your store wherein, one of the representatives asked me to follow some steps and fixed time with me, so that an engineer from your company will visit my place. It has been past few weeks from the date of appointment, but no one ever visited to troubleshoot nor called me to rearrange the meeting.

I am not satisfied with your teams' post-sales services and entitled to request you to take the processor back and provide me with my refund. I have made up my mind and would not prefer to receive any further calls from your end to provide me alternate solutions and offers.
